types.struct open_event: fields: hdr struct event_header, uid unsigned int, filename char[256]
types.struct event_header: fields: timestamp_ns uint64_t, pid uint32_t, tid uint32_t, comm char[16], event_type uint8_t, _pad uint8_t[7]
types.struct latency_event: fields: hdr struct event_header, syscall_nr uint64_t, duration_ns uint64_t, start_time_ns uint64_t
types.struct tcp_event: fields: hdr struct event_header, ip_version uint8_t, old_state uint8_t, new_state uint8_t, _pad1 uint8_t, sport uint16_t, dport uint16_t, addr union { v4 struct { saddr_v4 uint32_t, daddr_v4 uint32_t }, v6 struct { saddr_v6 uint8_t[16], daddr_v6 uint8_t[16] } }
types.struct conn_key: fields: saddr uint64_t[2], daddr uint64_t[2], sport uint16_t, dport uint16_t, ip_version uint8_t, padding uint8_t[3]
types.struct conn_value: fields: start_ns uint64_t, pid uint32_t, uid uint32_t
types.struct histogram: fields: buckets uint64_t[128], max_bucket int, total uint64_t, syscall_nr uint64_t, syscall_name char[32]
types.struct connection_entry: fields: key struct conn_key, start_ns uint64_t, pid uint32_t, comm char[16], duration_ms uint32_t, state uint8_t, closed bool
types.struct dashboard_state: fields: histograms struct histogram[20], active_connections struct connection_entry[100], recent_connections struct connection_entry[50], event_counts uint64_t[10], total_events uint64_t, last_update struct timeval, config struct dashboard_config, main_win WINDOW*, header_win WINDOW*, histogram_win WINDOW*, connections_win WINDOW*, counters_win WINDOW*, footer_win WINDOW*, screen_rows int, screen_cols int, render_count uint64_t, event_rate uint64_t, cpu_usage double, active_histogram_count uint32_t, active_connection_count uint32_t, recent_connection_count uint32_t
types.struct dashboard_config: fields: refresh_ms uint32_t, histogram_max_us uint32_t, filter_pid uint32_t, filter_port uint16_t, sort_by uint8_t, paused bool, show_help bool
types.struct manager_state: fields: syscall_skel struct syscall_tracer_bpf*, tcp_skel struct tcp_tracer_bpf*, syscall_rb struct ring_buffer*, tcp_rb struct ring_buffer*, dashboard struct dashboard_state*
types.struct mock_ncurses_state: fields: call_count int[NCURSES_CALL_MAX], LINES int, COLS int, last_win WINDOW*, last_message char[256]

methods.bpf_ringbuf_reserve(struct *ringbuf_map,: reserves space in the ring buffer
methods.bpf_probe_read_user_str(void *dst, uint3: safely reads a null-terminated string from user-space
methods.bpf_get_current_pid_tgid() returns uint6: returns the current PID and TID packed
methods.bpf_get_current_comm(void *buf, uint32_t: fills buf with the current process name
methods.bpf_ringbuf_submit(void *data, uint64_t: submits a reserved ring buffer event
methods.ring_buffer__new(int map_fd, ring_buffer: creates a new ring buffer manager
methods.ring_buffer__poll(struct ring_buffer *rb: polls for events and calls the callback
methods.bpf_map_update_elem(struct bpf_map *map,: updates or adds an element in a BPF map
methods.histogram_update_from_log2(struct histog: convert kernel log2 histogram to linear buckets
methods.load_and_attach_program: Loads eBPF bytecode and attaches to probe
methods.detach_and_cleanup_program: Detaches eBPF program and cleans up resources
methods.read_and_aggregate_map: Reads and aggregates data from BPF maps
methods.update_program_filter: Updates BPF map to change program behavior
methods.get_manager_status: Returns snapshot of manager internal state
methods.handle_syscall_event: Callback for syscall ring buffer events
methods.handle_tcp_event: Callback for TCP ring buffer events
methods.manager_run_event_loop: Runs the main manager event loop
methods.aggregate_percpu_maps: Sums per-CPU map data into aggregated view
methods.setup_signal_handlers: Configures signal handlers for graceful exit
methods.should_exit: Checks atomic flag set by signal handler
methods.mock_ncurses_get_call_count(enum ncurses: get call count for ncurses function
methods.dump_bpf_map(const char *map_name) retur: dumps BPF map contents using bpftool
methods.dashboard_dump_state(const struct dashbo: writes dashboard state to file for debugging

constants.BPF_CORE_READ(src, field): macro for reading kernel structures portably
constants.BPF_MAP_TYPE_PERCPU_HASH: type constant for a per-CPU hash map
constants.BPF_ANY: flag for bpf_map_update_elem: create or update
constants.BPF_RB_FORCE_OVERWRITE: Ring buffer flag for overwrite on full
constants.NCURSES_CALL_MAX: maximum number of ncurses call types
constants.__FILENAME__: macro to get basename of file

terms.eBPF: Extended Berkeley Packet Filter, a VM in the Linux kernel for safe program execution
terms.verifier: The eBPF static analysis engine that ensures program safety
terms.JIT: Just-In-Time compiler that translates eBPF bytecode to native instructions
terms.kprobe: Kernel probe that allows dynamic breakpoints in kernel functions
terms.ring buffer: Single-producer, single-consumer circular buffer for events
terms.libbpf: The user-space library for loading and managing eBPF programs
terms.tracepoint: Static kernel instrumentation points with stable API
terms.BPF map: Shared memory region between kernel eBPF programs and user-space
terms.BPF CO-RE: Compile Once - Run Everywhere, for portable BPF programs
terms.BTF: BPF Type Format, for self-describing data structures
terms.LRU: Least Recently Used, a cache eviction policy
terms.BPF skeleton: Auto-generated header for loading BPF programs with libbpf
terms.lifecycle: The load, run, cleanup sequence of eBPF programs
terms.skeleton: Auto-generated libbpf header for eBPF object
terms.per-CPU map: BPF map with a separate instance for each CPU
terms.file descriptor (FD): Kernel reference to an open resource
terms.verifier log: detailed output from eBPF verifier explaining rejection reasons
terms.atomic operation: Thread-safe operation on a shared variable
terms.graceful shutdown: Clean resource release on program exit
terms.ncurses: terminal control library for text-based user interfaces
terms.adaptive refresh rate: refresh interval that adjusts based on system load
terms.per-CPU aggregation: summing data across all CPU instances of a map
terms.SIGWINCH: signal sent when terminal window resizes
terms.color pair: ncurses concept of foreground/background color combination
terms.batch update: updating all windows then refreshing once to reduce flicker
terms.link-time substitution: replacing library functions at link time for testing
terms.weak symbols: symbols that can be overridden by strong symbols
terms.user-mode BPF: BPF emulator that runs in user-space for testing
terms.mock kernel: simulated kernel environment for testing BPF programs
terms.trace pipe: kernel debug file that collects bpf_printk output
terms.bpftool: command-line utility for inspecting and manipulating BPF objects
terms.strace: system call tracer for debugging user-space programs
terms.dmesg: kernel message buffer for system-level errors
terms.debug mode: special operation mode that outputs internal state for troubleshooting
terms.log levels: severity classification for debugging messages (DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR)
terms.signal handler: function that handles OS signals like SIGINT for graceful shutdown
terms.CO-RE: Compile Once - Run Everywhere, for portable BPF programs across kernel versions
terms.visualization script: external tool to render BPF map contents in human-readable format
terms.Adaptive Refresh Rate: refresh interval that adjusts based on system load
terms.Atomic Operation: Thread-safe operation on a shared variable
terms.Batch Update: updating all windows then refreshing once to reduce flicker
terms.BPF Map: Shared memory region between kernel eBPF programs and user-space
terms.BPF Skeleton: Auto-generated header for loading BPF programs with libbpf
terms.Color Pair: ncurses concept of foreground/background color combination
terms.Debug Mode: special operation mode that outputs internal state for troubleshooting
terms.Dmesg: kernel message buffer for system-level errors
terms.Graceful Shutdown: Clean resource release on program exit
terms.Lifecycle: The load, run, cleanup sequence of eBPF programs
terms.Log Levels: severity classification for debugging messages (DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR)
terms.Mock Kernel: simulated kernel environment for testing BPF programs
terms.Per-CPU Aggregation: summing data across all CPU instances of a map
terms.Per-CPU Map: BPF map with a separate instance for each CPU
terms.Signal Handler: function that handles OS signals like SIGINT for graceful shutdown
terms.Trace Pipe: kernel debug file that collects bpf_printk output
terms.User-Mode BPF: BPF emulator that runs in user-space for testing
terms.Verifier Log: detailed output from eBPF verifier explaining rejection reasons
terms.Visualization Script: external tool to render BPF map contents in human-readable format
terms.Weak Symbols: symbols that can be overridden by strong symbols
